The claim was made by the Nigerian newsp: the Vanguard, stating that Nigeria ranks 15th in the world for its suicide rate.
The claim was attributed to Dr: Ani Kalayjian, the founder of a US-based organization that raises awareness about the effects of traumatic events on people.
The claim was verified by contacting Dr: Kalayjian, who confirmed that Nigeria is indeed ranked 15th in the world for its suicide rate according to the World Health Organization (WHO) data from 2016.
Africa Check: an organization that investigates and verifies claims, previously investigated a similar claim in 2018 and found that Nigeria had a lower crude suicide death rate of 9.5 suicides per 100,000 people in 2016, according to the WHO's Global Health Observatory data repository.
